page.title: 02HOUSING IN LANGCLIFFE (1)
page.content:
The population of Langliffe has not greatly increased over the years, so it does not contain many modern houses. Those which have been built recently have been made to keep in with the character of the village. Consequently, there are very few houses in Langcliffe which are built of brick.
The traditional housing of the area is exemplified by one of the oldest buildings in Langcliffe. It is over 300 years old and stands behind the fountain in the middle of the village. The building is low, with a stone roof and tall chimney stacks at either end. It still has the original irregular, small mullioned windows.
